column1: Wishing you all a safe and happy Thanksgiving. Although we’re living in a strange and challenging time we still have a lot to be thankful for. https://t.co/3BE21EgZWv

We can eradicate COVID-19 and deliver real relief to get our economy back on track for working families that have been left behind for too long. We can create good paying jobs by repairing our crumbling infrastructure and tackling the existential threat of climate change.
The next Congress will face big challenges so we need to step up with big solutions. I’m calling on my colleagues to join me.  https://t.co/wzm23Kc2Lo
Today we honor those who have served America in uniform. Our veterans have put their lives on the line to protect our freedom and we owe them a debt of gratitude.

Millions of Americans are still out of work and too many small businesses are still barely getting by. I strongly urge my colleagues on both sides of the aisle to act swiftly on these common sense priorities.
I look forward to getting right to work with President-elect Biden on an economic recovery program that includes health care infrastructure and funding for local governments.

Congratulations to @JoeBiden and @KamalaHarris for winning the presidential election! Decency compassion and competency have won.  Now it's time for Americans to unite behind the Biden-Harris Administration so we can pursue science-based solutions to end the COVID19 pandemic.
Congratulations 46!
@AnnMcLaneKuster @NHDems It was my pleasure to be there - glad to see Keene is fired up and ready to go!

Hello New Hampshire! I’m joining my friend @AnnMcLaneKuster today to get out the vote for Joe Biden. Don’t wake up tomorrow wishing you had done more - go cast your ballot today. https://t.co/XPKpqsy4fD

Massachusetts it's time to get out there and vote! Our state's polls are open until 8 PM so let's show our support for @JoeBiden @KamalaHarris @EdMarkey and Democrats up and down the ballot. Find your polling place at https://t.co/15B5ZhHG1p.

It was my great pleasure to kick off today's MA virtual phone bank for @JoeBiden.  We need all hands on deck today and tomorrow to retake the White House and elect Democrats up and down the ballot. Sign up for a shift today! https://t.co/ROnxPeF7B1 https://t.co/nHAnThZQRm

It was a privilege to witness day in and day out his devotion to civil rights equality and getting in “good trouble.” America has lost a giant but John Lewis's legacy and what he represented will stand the test of time.
I'll never forget traveling with John to Selma several years ago and walking across the Edmund Pettus Bridge with him revisiting the site where he nearly lost his life in the fight for civil rights.
For nearly thirty years I had the honor of serving on Ways & Means with John Lewis. He was my colleague friend and brother. https://t.co/bsCnsywqBi

There's always more work to be done and as an ally I'm always listening and learning. But you can also count on me to take action - because #lovewins but not without a fight. (8/8)
🏳️‍🌈 I highlighted the problem of tax exemptions for organizations that promote hate and intolerance. (7/8)
🏳️‍🌈 I invited PULSE Nightclub shooting survivor Brandon Wolf to testify on Capitol Hill. (6/8)
🏳️‍🌈 I voted for the Equality Act to guarantee full civil rights protections to all LGBTQ+ people. (5/8)
🏳️‍🌈 I championed the PRIDE Act which will finally require the IRS to treat same-sex couples equally. (4/8)
🏳️‍🌈 I spoke out against Trump's hateful decision to ban trans people from military service. (3/8)
🏳️‍🌈 I cosponsored the Protecting LGBTQ Youth Act because it's on all of us to keep kids safe.  (2/8)
